page.title: 02Farming on Todmorden Moor
page.content: The area is rough moorland grass which has been enclosed in parts for pasture land. My name is{Robert Sutcliffe}and my dad owns about 1000 acres in the area and rents another 150 acres.Until this year we kept{sheep}and a few{Hereford} {cattle}but now we have only the sheep.Our flock is around 350 made up of a variety of sheep which can survive on the poor land.We also have some shearlings (one year old sheep) which will be added to the flock and about 300 lamb crosses which we have bred this year.Most of these lambs will be sold but we will keep about 60 for ourselves. The sheep are kept for the{wool}and usually graze freely on the moorland. We farm about 15 acres for hay which is used as winter feed and bedding.
